ai.summary: Fladdabister offers an 8.4 km moderate coastal hike in the UK. The route traverses grassy cliff-top trails and rocky shorelines, delivering open sea views and a mix of easy and moderately challenging sections. Ideal for hikers with steady footing and an appetite for exposed coastal scenery.
ai.terrain_summary: Mixed coastal terrain: grassy tracks, compact soil, and several rocky, uneven patches. Some sections may be muddy after rain. Expect wind exposure along the shoreline and occasional steps or boardwalks in rougher spots.
ai.safety_notes: Weather in the UK can change quickly; check forecast and tide times if the route skirts the coast. Wear sturdy boots with good grip and bring layers, waterproofs, and sun protection. Carry a map and compass or GPS, a charged phone, and a basic first aid kit. Let someone know your plan and expected return time. Start early in autumn/winter daylight hours.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Map and compass or GPS device
Head covering and gloves for cool weather
First aid kit and emergency whistle
ai.best_seasons: Late spring to early autumn (roughly April–September), with the best conditions typically from May to September.

seo.title: Fladdabister Hike – 8.4 km Moderate Coastal Trail in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover Fladdabister, an 8.4 km moderate coastal hike in the UK. Learn about terrain, safety tips, gear, and the best seasons for this scenic trail.
